conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of the skydiver over time. The velocity is measured in meters per second (m/s), and time is measured in seconds (s).
We are looking at the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
From the graph, observe the velocity during the 0 to 10 seconds interval. The velocity is increasing from 0 to 10 seconds.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
If velocity is increasing, the acceleration is positive. If velocity is decreasing, the acceleration is negative.
The slope of the tangent line to the curve at any point represents the acceleration at that point.
From the image, the red tangent lines show that the slope is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.

premise: Since the velocity is increasing (going from 0 to a positive value) and the slope of the tangent lines is positive.

conclusion: Therefore, the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is upwards.
